greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of colored integer partitions of n using all colors of a k-set such that all parts have different color patterns and a pattern for part i has i distinct colors in increasing order; triangle T(n,k), k>=0, k<=n<=k*2^(k-1), read by columns.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for all n>=0 and k>=0.  The triangle displays only positive terms.  All other terms are zero.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Columns k = 0..10, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0, add(
b(n-i*j, min(n-i*j, i-1), k)*C(C(k, i), j), j=0..n/i)))
mathematica: Table[Table[T[n, k], {n, k, k 2^(k-1)}], {k, 0, 5}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 17 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Cf. A001787, A255903, A326914 (this triangle read by rows), A327115, A327116, A327117.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 13 2019
